text: the streaks of what were for so long a
no-go area are now in gridlock trapping
is streaming in and out of the old city
of homs people are coming back to get
what's left in their ravaged homes
trucks that are carrying all their
household goods taking them away it's
still not a place where you can live
there's no water there's no electricity
here look at the rubble that lies on
these streets the cleanup has begun the
rubble has been moved to the side the
people are coming back to their homes
but look at the damage that's been
caused nearly two years of the heavy
fighting that went on here the almost
daily bombardments the gunfights and the
punishing siege which means that most
people who lived here left more than two
years ago the people we've been meeting
here today are seeing their houses for
the first time can send it here the
worst and that's what they're seeing
their houses lion ruin many of them have
been looted and now as they pick up the
pieces they tell us it's not just the
buildings that have to be restored the
very fabric of this community where
Christians and Muslims of various sects
all live together it's all been ripped
apart in here the old city of Homs lies
a symbol
a punishing war
